chargeHist.descr: OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Russell Eugene Fryer was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to sign up for Probation in St. Croix County Jail.
Defendant is entitled to 45 days credit under 973.155.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Russell Eugene Fryer appeared. Includes 14CF431, 14TR4704 and 14TR4705. Case called at 4:14 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites. No objection from Atty Amann.  Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one. Count two is dismissed. Court dismissed 14TR4704 and 14TR4705. Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court orders: 2 yrs probation w/h with conditions - 
- 180 Days Jail. 90 Days STAYED. Credit for 45 days. Good Time. Huber for work and treatment
- F/F $1694.00
- $52.00 for blood draw
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- 48 month revocation, with credit for adminstrative suspension
- 48 month IID
- AODA
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortative Justice
- Victim Empathy Seminar
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
